user.title: Core Configuration
user.description: Let's start with the basics. Select the inverter switch and your battery details.

data_description.inverter_switch_entity_id: The switch entity that controls whether the inverter charges from the grid.
data_description.battery_capacity_kwh: The total usable energy capacity of your battery in kWh.
data_description.battery_soc_sensor_entity_id: The sensor indicating the current battery percentage (0-100%).

sensors.title: Sensors Setup
sensors.description: Select the sensors used to monitor consumption and solar forecast.

data_description.house_load_power_sensor_entity_id: A sensor measuring the instantaneous power consumption of the house (Watts). Used to learn daily habits.
data_description.solar_forecast_sensor_entity_id: A sensor providing the estimated solar production for the next day (kWh).
data_description.solar_forecast_today_sensor: A sensor providing the estimated solar production for today (kWh). Used for recalculations after midnight.

tuning.title: Tuning & Notifications
tuning.description: Fine-tune the algorithm and setup notifications.

data_description.min_soc_reserve_percent: The battery level (%) that should always be preserved and never counted as 'available' for tomorrow's load.
data_description.safety_spread_percent: Percentage of extra energy to charge on top of the calculated need, acting as a safety buffer.
data_description.notify_service: Optional. A notification service (e.g. notify.mobile_app_...) to receive a summary every morning.
data_description.battery_bypass_switch: Optional. A switch that prevents battery discharge (allows only charging). Used for EV integration to prevent the car from draining the home battery.
